channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump launches unprecedented attack on China
item.description: President Donald Trump launched a blistering attack on China Friday, naming misdeeds that range from espionage to the violation of Hong Kong's freedoms, and announced a slew of retaliatory measures that will plunge US-China relations deeper into crisis.

item.title: US quitting World Health Organization, Trump says
item.description: President Donald Trump announced on Friday that the United States will terminate its relationship with the World Health Organization, a move he has threatened throughout the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Ex-officer who knelt on George Floyd's neck charged with murder
New video appears to show George Floyd being kneeled on by 3 officers
item.description: A new video posted on social media appears to show three Minneapolis Police Department officers kneeling on George Floyd during his arrest.

item.title: Floyd was 'non-responsive' for nearly 3 minutes before officer took knee off his neck, complaint says
Wave of violence against black people throws black parents a devastating challenge
item.description: It's time to have a talk about "The Talk."

item.title: WHO launches global information access portal for Covid-19
This is how loved ones want us to remember George Floyd
item.description: George Floyd moved to Minnesota for a fresh start â€” an opportunity to better himself and to be a better father.

item.title: CNN's Omar Jimenez released from custody: We didn't get a 'sorry' from officers
item.description: CNN's Omar Jimenez is released from police custody after being arrested while covering protests over the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis. Minnesota State Patrol arrested the team live on CNN air.

item.title: Trump tweets threat that 'looting' will lead to 'shooting.' Twitter put a warning label on it
Arresting reporters at a protest is an affront to the First Amendment
Joe Biden discusses his phone call with George Floyd's family
item.description: Former Vice President Joe Biden talks to CNN's Don Lemon about offering solace during a phone call he had with George Floyd's family.

item.title: These could be the world's next coronavirus hotspots, according to world health experts
7 people shot in protests over the fatal police shooting of Breonna Taylor, police say
item.description: One of the attorneys for Kenneth Walker released audio Thursday of the 911 call placed by Walker after his girlfriend Breonna Taylor was shot and killed by Louisville Metro Police in her home in March.

item.title: A Kansas soldier likely saved 'countless lives' by driving into an active shooter, police say
item.description: Master Sgt. David Royer stood upright with his interlocking hands in front of him Thursday as he matter-of-factly recounted how he rammed his truck into an active shooter before heading home to hug his kids, mow the grass and have dinner.

item.title: Germany to reintroduce military rabbis for the first time since 1930s
item.description: Germany is reintroducing rabbis into its military for the first time since the Nazis banned them from the armed forces in the 1930s.

item.title: China is embracing a new brand of foreign policy: 'wolf warrior' diplomacy
item.description: There is a new brand of diplomacy taking hold in Beijing and its chief architects have a suitably fierce nickname to match their aggressive style -- they are the "wolf warriors."

item.title: The racist origin of the phrase Trump tweeted
item.description: President Trump tweeted about nationwide protests over George Floyd's death, saying "when the looting starts the shooting starts." Trump and the White House have since said that the tweet was not intended as a threat. CNN's Abby Phillip reports on the racist history tied to the phrase.

item.title: Protesting Russian journalists charged with violating lockdown laws
item.description: Several prominent Russian journalists have been charged with violating laws on protesting and social distancing, after being temporarily detained on Thursday in Moscow. They had been holding separate solo demonstrations in support of a jailed colleague, according to statements from their employers.

item.title: WWII aircraft buried by sand discovered on beach after 76 years
item.description: A British couple have found the wreckage of a crashed World War II fighter jet, believed to be a Bristol Beaufighter TF.X aircraft, on a beach in northeastern England.

item.title: Woman kept grandmother's body in basement freezer for 16 years in social security scheme, police say
item.description: Last year, police in Pennsylvania found old human remains in a freezer. Now, an investigation has concluded that it was all part of a scam to collect social security checks.

item.title: German scientists hope human excrement can help warn of outbreaks
item.description: German scientists hope that human excrement can help detect early traces of Covid-19. They say traces of the virus can be found in wastewater and could predict potential outbreak areas. CNN's Fred Pleitgen explains.

item.title: Monkeys snatch blood samples of suspected Covid-19 patients
item.description: A troop of monkeys snatched the blood samples of suspected coronavirus patients at a government hospital in the Meerut district of the north Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.

item.title: What Poland's 'ghost' election' can teach us about pandemic-era democracy
item.description: A deeply divided country is preparing for a presidential election in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, facing starkly polarized debates about how to protect voters and still ensure them access to the ballot box.

item.title: Grandma steps in front of police guns to protect grandson
item.description: Police in Midland, Texas released video of the dramatic arrest of 21-year-old Tye Anders.

item.title: Renault to slash 14,600 jobs as coronavirus wreaks havoc on auto industry
item.description: Renault is slashing 14,600 jobs as part of a major overhaul deigned to reduce costs and help the French carmaker survive the coronavirus pandemic. Some 4,600 positions will be eliminated in France, with 10,000 more in other markets.

item.title: The worst is yet to come for India's slowing economy
item.description: India's economy kicked off 2020 with its weakest quarter in at least eight years. But the biggest drop is yet to come.

item.title: If you're going to go out to eat, listen to these tips
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta has some coronavirus safety tips for those who choose to start eating out at restaurants again.

item.title: World's oldest man dies 'peacefully in his sleep' at 112
item.description: Robert Weighton, the world's oldest man, died on Thursday at the age of 112, his family confirmed in a statement.

item.title: SoftBank doubled pay for Vision Fund boss as company posted record loss
item.description: SoftBank's Vision Fund chief Rajeev Misra got a huge pay bump even as the big tech fund dragged the Japanese company down to historic losses.

item.title: Van Jones calls out the dehumanization of African American men
item.description: CNN's Van Jones discusses the death of George Floyd, an African American man who died after being held down by a police officer's knee, and the implications this has on racial issues in the United States.

item.title: My bakery is a Covid-19 success story. But we are still struggling to get by
item.description: Weeks before Covid-19 hit the East Coast, my insurance company advised that loss of my business, Montclair Bread Co., would not be covered unless my town mandated the bakery's closure. They further advised, since the World Health Organization declared a pandemic, they would not be responsible for assistance. Armed with this knowledge, I acted fast to turn my bakery into an artisan bodega when New Jersey issued stay-at-home orders on March 21.

item.title: This incredibly popular store is one of the hardest to socially distance in
item.description: TJ Maxx built its appeal on the "treasure hunt" shopping experience. Now it must persuade shoppers that it's safe to return to scavenging stores in the age of a pandemic.

item.title: As a female footballer it's 'impossible to not be standing for equality,' says Ada Hegerberg
item.description: It doesn't take long to understand what type of person Ada Hegerberg is. One of the world's best female footballers certainly likes to be punctual.

item.title: No sports, no packed casinos. See Las Vegas begin reopening
item.description: You won't find crowds, concerts or conventions in Las Vegas this summer and gambling will be very different. Regardless, the city is still aiming to be a great escape.

item.title: World's deepest octopus, complete with Dumbo ears, captured on film 4 miles below the surface
item.description: The deepest known sighting of an octopus has been captured on film, more than a mile deeper than the previous reliable sighting.

item.title: We have different attitudes toward social distancing, and it's straining relationships
item.description: Andrew remembers the week everything changed.

item.title: Inside the last of Germany's disappearing nuclear plants
item.description: After an earthquake and tsunami triggered multiple meltdowns at Japan's Fukushima Daiichi power plant in 2011, the shockwaves were felt across the world's nuclear industry. Over 5,000 miles away in Germany, where the use of atomic energy had long been a matter of contention, the incident sounded a death knell.

item.title: 'Space Force' casts Steve Carell in a broad satire that never achieves liftoff
item.description: Reuniting Steve Carell and "The Office" producer Greg Daniels, "Space Force" carries such an impressive payload -- from the star-heavy cast to the concept -- it's a shame the actual show isn't better. As is, this too-broad parody has sporadic moments but consistently feels like it's trying way too hard to achieve liftoff, like an "Airplane!" movie gone wrong.

item.title: This app uses science and tradition to warn African farmers of drought
item.description: An app is combining weather station data with the traditional knowledge of African farmers to predict droughts.

item.title: Preserved ancient Roman mosaic floor found in Italy
item.description: A well preserved ancient Roman floor has been discovered under a vineyard in Negrar, Italy.

item.title: Lady Gaga releases highly anticipated new album 'Chromatica'
item.description: It's finally here!

item.title: Why Starbucks coffee tastes like travel
item.description: On most days I am loyal to my locally owned coffee shop. I spent years working as a barista myself, pulling shots of espresso and pouring silky steamed milk into ceramic mugs -- a wiggle of the wrist to finish it off with a snow-white pattern in caramel-colored foam. My fellow third-wave coffee crafters and I would cringe if someone ordered a tall instead of a small.

item.title: Pain and anger across America
Ex-officer who knelt on Floyd's neck charged with murder
item.description: â€¢ CNN crew released after being arrested while covering protests â€¢ ANALYSIS: What Trump's tweet reveals about his moral compass â€¢ ANALYSIS: The White House podium has lost its meaning â€¢ CNN legal analyst breaks down charges against ex-officer

item.title: US and Europe 'missed early chance to slow coronavirus'
The Latin American country that got its Covid-19 response right
item.description: Wuhan was the original epicenter. Then the coronavirus migrated to Europe. New York was the next hotspot, and now world health authorities are worried about South America.

item.title: More than 500 schools close after reopening
item.description: More than 500 schools closed again Friday to students after briefly reopening, as South Korea moves to stamp out a resurgence of the coronavirus in the capital, Seoul, and its surrounding metropolitan area.

item.title: Sweden went for 'herd immunity' and the early results are in
item.description: Sweden adopted a 'herd immunity' plan that uses more relaxed measures to control coronavirus, but a survey by the government found only 7.3 percent of people inÂ StockholmÂ had developed the antibodies needed to fight the disease. CNN's Phil Black reports.

item.title: What to know about SpaceX launch: Round 2
item.description: SpaceX and NASA are, once again, gearing up to try to make history by launching two astronauts into Earth's orbit.
